Republique du Cap Vert - Project
            d'Appui au Secteur Routier (RSSP) : etude d'impact
            sur l'environnement

abstracts.cdata!:
he development objective for the
            additional financing of the Cape Verde Road Sector Support
            Project remains unchanged. The projects development
            objective is to increase mobility of people in the targeted
            areas and improve the planning and financing of the Road
            Sector. The project will contribute to the higher level
            poverty reduction objectives of promoting economic growth
            and improving living conditions. This is being done by
            supporting improved management of the roads and
            infrastructure sectors and reducing the vulnerability of
            road networks, thus facilitating physical access by the poor
            to market opportunities and social services. The
            environmental impacts are expected to be minimal. The social
            impacts are expected to be positive. The environmental
            impacts of the upgrading of the rural roads to a stone-paved
            road are also estimated to be limited. The social impacts
            will be very positive and contribute to reducing poverty in
            the area by improving access to markets by local farmers.
            The negative impacts will occur mainly during the
            construction period of the road, in particular on the
            resources of the soil (modification of physical
            characteristics), on the water resources (pollution of
            surface and underground waters) and on the atmosphere (dust,
            smoke, noise). The impacts during the operational period
            will be very limited and only related to the increment of
            the road traffic. The project spells out the mitigation
            measures which will be taken to minimize the impacts, which
            include a list of the good practices to adopt for the
            mitigation of the impacts and the control of the environment
            quality after construction.
